House panel orders NTC to explain why it should not be cited in contempt over ABS-CBN shutdown tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-737673 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/737673/house-panel-orders-ntc-to-explain-why-it-should-not-be-cited-in-contempt-over-abs-cbn-shutdown/story/ The House Committee on Legislative Franchises has ordered officials of the National Telecommunications Commission (NTC) to explain why they should not be cited in contempt for issuing a cease and desist order to stop the broadcast operations of ABS-CBN. Mon, 11 May 2020 13:00:28 +0800
Gov t agency heads can combine, adopt own alternative work arrangements amid COVID-19 emergency -- CSC tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-737672 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/737672/gov-t-agency-heads-can-combine-adopt-own-alternative-work-arrangements-amid-covid-19-emergency-csc/story/ The CSC said the revised guidelines will take effect on May 22 and apply retroactively. They will remain in force until President Rodrigo Duterte lifts the state of national emergency. Mon, 11 May 2020 12:52:28 +0800
New Zealand to ease some coronavirus restrictions starting Thursday tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-737668 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/world/737668/new-zealand-to-ease-some-coronavirus-restrictions-starting-thursday/story/ New Zealand will allow restaurants, cafes, cinemas, malls and travel within the country to resume starting Thursday as it eases most restrictions that were put in place to stop the spread of the coronavirus, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said on Monday. Mon, 11 May 2020 12:42:16 +0800
CHED: Classes should all start in August amid COVID-19 crisis tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-737667 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/737667/ched-classes-should-all-start-in-august-amid-covid-19-crisis/story/ Private universities still using the old academic calendar where classes start in June should now adopt the new calendar of opening classes in August amid the COVID-19 pandemic, the Commission on Higher Education (CHED) said Monday. Mon, 11 May 2020 12:34:08 +0800
DepEd: Private schools may open as early as June, but no face-to-face learning before Aug. 24 tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-737665 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/737665/deped-private-schools-may-open-as-early-as-june-but-no-face-to-face-learning-before-aug-24/story/ The Department of Education (DepEd) said Monday private schools may be allowed to open as early as June, but no "face-to-face" learning will be allowed earlier than August 24, 2020. Mon, 11 May 2020 11:56:47 +0800
Senate reporters urge House to fast-track deliberation of ABS-CBN franchise renewal tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-737664 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/737664/senate-reporters-urge-congress-to-fast-track-deliberation-of-abs-cbn-franchise-renewal/story/ The House of Representatives should start hearing the bills seeking the renewal of ABS-CBN Corporation's franchise following its shutdown last week, journalists covering the Senate said in a solidarity statement on Monday. Mon, 11 May 2020 11:49:21 +0800
Nightlife cluster gives South Korea largest case rise in a month tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-737662 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/world/737662/nightlife-cluster-gives-south-korea-largest-case-rise-in-a-month/story/ The nation has been held up as a global model in how to curb the virus, but over the weekend its capital -- as well as neighboring Gyeonggi province and the nearby city of Incheon -- ordered the closure of all clubs and bars after a burst of new cases sparked fears of a second wave. Mon, 11 May 2020 11:36:50 +0800
PNP supports proposal to limit barangay population to 15,000 tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-737660 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/737660/pnp-supports-proposal-to-limit-barangay-population-to-15-000/story/ The Philippine National Police (PNP) on Monday expressed support for a House bill which seeks to limit the population of barangays to 15,000. Mon, 11 May 2020 11:29:49 +0800
Solon proposes House to intervene in ABS-CBN petition vs. NTC before SC tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-737657 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/737657/solon-proposes-house-to-intervene-in-abs-cbn-petition-vs-ntc-before-sc/story/ "With respect to the House, the Order arrogates into itself the House s exclusive constitutional power to grant, extend, deny or revoke franchises," Ako Bicol party-list Representative Alfredo Garbin Jr."Thus, in order to protect the House s interest and to comply with its constitutional mandate, it is best for the House and/or the Committee on Legislative Franchises, to intervene in the ABS-CBN Petition while the committee is deliberating on the franchise," he added. Mon, 11 May 2020 11:18:42 +0800
Gov't urged to stop chicken importation due to low demand amid COVID-19 tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-737652 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/737652/gov-t-urged-to-stop-chicken-importation-due-to-low-demand-amid-covid-19/story/ “Hirap na hirap na kami simula nung nag-ECQ tayo kasi lumiit ang demand eh. Ang malaking consumption ng manok ay galing sa hotels, restaurants, fastfood. Eh sarado lahat bigla,” United Broiler Raisers Association chairman Gregorio San Diego said in an interview over Dobol B sa News TV. Mon, 11 May 2020 10:20:41 +0800
Manila Bay looks even more picturesque as city remains quiet under ECQ tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-737647 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/metro/737647/manila-bay-looks-even-more-picturesque-as-city-remains-quiet-under-ecq/story/ Almost two months after the City of Manila -- along with the rest of Metro Manila -- has been placed under enhanced community quarantine due to the COVID-19 threat, Manila Bay looks even more picturesque and beautiful on Monday morning. Mon, 11 May 2020 09:56:45 +0800
SUV sa Pagadian, nahulog sa bangin dahil sa ulang hatid ng bagyong Ambo tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-737646 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/ulatfilipino/737646/suv-sa-pagadian-nahulog-sa-bangin-dahil-sa-ulang-hatid-ng-bagyong-ambo/story/ Isang SUV ang nahulog sa bangin nitong Linggo ng gabi dahil sa ulang dulot ng bagyong Ambo sa Pagadian City sa Zamboanga del Sur, ayon sa ulat ng Unang Balita nitong Lunes. Mon, 11 May 2020 09:40:13 +0800
US adds 776 coronavirus deaths in 24 hours; death toll now 79,522 --Johns Hopkins tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-737645 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/world/737645/us-adds-776-coronavirus-deaths-in-24-hours-death-toll-now-79-522-johns-hopkins/story/ The United States recorded 776 coronavirus deaths in the past 24 hours, bringing the total to 79,522, according to the real-time tally by Johns Hopkins University at 8:30 pm Sunday (0030 GMT Monday). Mon, 11 May 2020 09:32:14 +0800
Public should observe new normal to prevent new wave of COVID-19 cases, DOH-NCR exec says tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-737644 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/737644/public-should-observe-new-normal-to-prevent-new-wave-of-covid-19-cases-doh-ncr-exec-says/story/ “As we shift to kung anong phase ang mairekomenda ng Inter-Agency Task Force, kinakailangan pa rin po yung tinatawag nating new normal,” DOH-NCR regional director Corazon Flores said“Ito pong strategy natin sa pagkontrol ng COVID, hindi lamang po goyerno ang kailangan kumilos dito, pati po yung mamamayan,” she added. Mon, 11 May 2020 09:23:25 +0800
Camp Karingal placed on lockdown after 13 personnel, 1 soldier test positive for COVID-19 tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-737643 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/737643/camp-karingal-placed-on-lockdown-after-13-personnel-1-soldier-test-positive-for-covid-19/story/ Camp Karingal, the headquarters of the Quezon City Police District (QCPD), is on a three-day lockdown as some personnel have tested positive for coronavirus disease 2019. Mon, 11 May 2020 09:21:17 +0800
